Author: MetaJames#2985
Content: I'm trying to download the ocean-qt wallet, and encountering an issue.... It's the first time to install it on my PC. I'm getting the error - *Cannot parse configuration file. Missing komodo.conf. Only use key=value syntax* I'm using Windows 10.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: copy the komodo.conf that's in the zip file to %appdata%/komodo

Author: MetaJames#2985
Content: That worked, but now I am getting the ... *Cannot find ZCash parameters* error

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
there should be a cmd file to fetch params that was in the zip, as well
open cmd and just drag the file into it and hit enter

Author: MetaJames#2985
Content: It worked, thanks

Author: jctomic#3970
Content: Hello. I bootstrapped as explained above (deleted files and folders and extracted as instructed) but the software just started syncing everything again from 0%. Is this what should happen?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@jctomic it must be loading the blocks
did it finish syncing?

Author: jctomic#3970
Content: Nope. I didn‚Äôt let it. I don‚Äôt want to wait days again. Can I recover my funds using another wallet software ? This one is not for me

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
no matter what GUI you pick, you need to let the sync finish (unless you use a "lite" mode type thing where someone else stores the full chain)
that's how blockchains work

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: also, if the GUI truly "just started syncing everything again from 0%", then it's possible you placed the files in the wrong location (unless you mean "rescan" and not "syncing")

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: extreme data corruption is the only reason that it would disregard all data and start syncing from block 0

Author: jctomic#3970
Content: Yup. Probably messed up. No problem. Will figure it out. Someday
